"About Fanny? ~~~ But, my dear fellow--I should hope so!	Son pere recula d'un pas, degageant son bras : -- Avec Fanny ?	-0.012766
Only I don't see--" "Dash it, Dad, don't be prehistoric!	Mais, mon ami, je l'espere bien ; seulement, je ne vois pas... -- Voyons, pere, ne soyez pas cachottier !	0.05625
Wasn't she--once--your Fanny?"	N'a-t-elle pas ete, autrefois, votre Fanny ?	0.196552
Dallas belonged body and soul to the new generation.	Dallas appartenait de tout son etre a la nouvelle generation.	0.846667
He was the first-born of Newland and May Archer, yet it had never been possible to inculcate in him even the rudiments of reserve.	A ce premier ne de Newland et de May Archer, il avait ete impossible d'inculquer les plus elementaires notions de reserve.	0.830891
"What's the use of making mysteries?	<< Pourquoi faire des mysteres ?	0.257143
It only makes people want to nose 'em out," he always objected when enjoined to discretion.	Les gens flairent toujours ce qu'on veut leur cacher, >> objectait-il quand on lui recommandait la discretion.	0.406341
But Archer, meeting his eyes, saw the filial light under their banter.	Mais Archer, rencontrant les yeux de son fils, sentit la lueur filiale sous la malice.	0.465769
	-- Ma << Fanny >>... ?	-0.3
"My Fanny?"	-- Eh bien !	0.27
"Well, the woman you'd have chucked everything for: only you didn't," continued his surprising son.	la femme pour laquelle vous auriez tout envoye promener. ~~~ Seulement, vous ne l'avez pas fait.	-0.00925926
"I didn't," echoed Archer with a kind of solemnity.	-- Non, je ne l'ai pas fait, repeta Archer avec une sorte de solennite.	0.497727
"No: you date, you see, dear old boy.	-- Vous datez, voyez-vous, mon pauvre papa !	0.232258
But mother said--" "Your mother?"	Ma mere m'a dit... -- Ta mere ?	0.24
"Yes: the day before she died.	-- Oui, la veille de sa mort.	0.275
It was when she sent for me alone--you remember?	Quand elle a voulu me voir seul. ~~~ Vous vous rappelez ?	0.109722
She said she knew we were safe with you, and always would be, because once, when she asked you to, you'd given up the thing you most wanted."	Elle m'a dit qu'elle etait tranquille en nous quittant parce qu'une fois, quand elle vous en avait fait la demande, vous lui aviez sacrifie la chose a laquelle vous teniez le plus.	0.208696
Archer received this strange communication in silence.	Archer recut en silence cette singuliere communication.	0.668878
His eyes remained unseeingly fixed on the thronged sunlit square below the window.	Son regard perdu embrassa la place ensoleillee ou s'ecoulaient les passants.	0.28209
At length he said in a low voice: "She never asked me."	Enfin, il dit a voix basse : -- Elle ne me l'a jamais demande.	0.497436
"No. ~~~ I forgot.	-- Non, naturellement.	-0.06
You never did ask each other anything, did you?	Vous ne vous etes jamais rien demande l'un a l'autre, n'est-ce pas ?	0.1725
And you never told each other anything.	Et vous ne vous etes jamais rien dit.	0.270968
You just sat and watched each other, and guessed at what was going on underneath. ~~~ A deaf-and-dumb asylum, in fact!	Vous etes restes l'un devant l'autre, a observer, a deviner ce qui se passait en dedans, -- un duo de sourds-muets, pas vrai ?	-0.00918367
Well, I back your generation for knowing more about each other's private thoughts than we ever have time to find out about our own.--I say, Dad," Dallas broke off, "you're not angry with me?	Avec cela, je parie que chacun de vous en savait plus long sur ce que pensait l'autre que nous ne savons, nous, sur ce que nous pensons nous-memes.	0.208264
If you are, let's make it up and go and lunch at Henri's.	Nous n'avons pas le temps...	0.048

Archer did not accompany his son to Versailles.	Archer n'accompagna pas son fils a Versailles.	1.425
He preferred to spend the afternoon in solitary roamings through Paris.	Il prefera vaguer seul a travers la lumineuse solitude de Paris.	0.511818
He had to deal all at once with the packed regrets and stifled memories of an inarticulate lifetime.	Les regrets accumules, les souvenirs etouffes d'une vie muette, pesaient lourdement sur son ame...	0.492857
After a little while he did not regret Dallas's indiscretion.	A la reflexion, il ne regretta pas l'indiscretion de Dallas.	0.294231
It seemed to take an iron band from his heart to know that, after all, some one had guessed and pitied.... And that it should have been his wife moved him indescribably.	Il sentit son coeur allege d'un lourd fardeau. ~~~ Quelqu'un avait donc devine, avait eu pitie ; et que ce quelqu'un eut ete May, il en ressentait une emotion indicible.	-0.00107914
Dallas, for all his affectionate insight, would not have understood that.	Dallas, avec toute sa perspicacite affectueuse, n'aurait pas compris cela.	0.563352
To the boy, no doubt, the episode was only a pathetic instance of vain frustration, of wasted forces.	Pour l'enfant, sans doute, l'episode n'etait que l'exemple pathetique d'une vie gachee.	0.268831
But was it really no more?	N'etait-ce vraiment que cela ?	0.231818
For a long time Archer sat on a bench in the Champs Elysees and wondered, while the stream of life rolled by.... A few streets away, a few hours away, Ellen Olenska waited.	Longtemps, Archer, assis sur un banc aux Champs-Elysees, resta perdu dans ses pensees.	0.036
She had never gone back to her husband, and when he had died, some years before, she had made no change in her way of living.	Autour de lui, la vie... la vie des autres... passait comme un fleuve.	0.0864407
There was nothing now to keep her and Archer apart--and that afternoon he was to see her.	La, tout pres, cette meme fin d'apres-midi, Ellen Olenska l'attendait.	0.241935
He got up and walked across the Place de la Concorde and the Tuileries gardens to the Louvre.	Elle n'etait jamais retournee chez son mari, et depuis la mort d'Olenski, elle n'avait rien change a sa maniere de vivre.	0.518387
She had once told him that she often went there, and he had a fancy to spend the intervening time in a place where he could think of her as perhaps having lately been.	Il n'y avait plus rien pour la separer d'Archer : tout a l'heure, il allait la voir.	0.17971
For an hour or more he wandered from gallery to gallery through the dazzle of afternoon light, and one by one the pictures burst on him in their half-forgotten splendour, filling his soul with the long echoes of beauty.		-0.3
After all, his life had been too starved....	Il se leva et traversa le jardin des Tuileries.	0.284211
Suddenly, before an effulgent Titian, he found himself saying: "But I'm only fifty-seven--" and then he turned away.		-0.3
For such summer dreams it was too late; but surely not for a quiet harvest of friendship, of comradeship, in the blessed hush of her nearness.		-0.3
He went back to the hotel, where he and Dallas were to meet; and together they walked again across the Place de la Concorde and over the bridge that leads to the Chamber of Deputies.	Mme Olenska lui avait dit une fois qu'elle allait souvent au Louvre, et il eut la fantaisie de passer les heures de l'attente dans un endroit ou peut-etre elle avait ete recemment.	0.479805
Dallas, unconscious of what was going on in his father's mind, was talking excitedly and abundantly of Versailles.	Pendant plus d'une heure, il erra de salle en salle dans l'eblouissement d'une journee de printemps.	0.25814
He had had but one previous glimpse of it, during a holiday trip in which he had tried to pack all the sights he had been deprived of when he had had to go with the family to Switzerland; and tumultuous enthusiasm and cock-sure criticism tripped each other up on his lips.	L'un apres l'autre, des tableaux se revelaient a lui dans leur splendeur a moitie oubliee, et il se laissait peu a peu envahir par les emotions qu'inspire la beaute.	0.217391
As Archer listened, his sense of inadequacy and inexpressiveness increased.	La beaute, il en avait eu faim toute sa vie...	0.0710526
The boy was not insensitive, he knew; but he had the facility and self-confidence that came of looking at fate not as a master but as an equal.	Soudain, devant un triomphal Titien, il se prit a dire : << Mais je n'ai que cinquante-sept ans !	0.31125
"That's it: they feel equal to things--they know their way about," he mused, thinking of his son as the spokesman of the new generation which had swept away all the old landmarks, and with them the sign-posts and the danger-signal.	>> Puis, il se detourna. ~~~ Pour les reves du chaud ete, c'etait trop tard ; mais non pour un tranquille automne aupres d'Ellen, dans la paix benie de sa presence.	-0.0660448
Suddenly Dallas stopped short, grasping his father's arm.	Il revint a l'hotel ou il devait retrouver Dallas.	0.244186
"Oh, by Jove," he exclaimed. ~~~ They had come out into the great tree-planted space before the Invalides.	Tous deux traverserent la place de la Concorde et la Seine, s'engagerent sur l'Esplanade des Invalides.	0.0534799
The dome of Mansart floated ethereally above the budding trees and the long grey front of the building: drawing up into itself all the rays of afternoon light, it hung there like the visible symbol of the race's glory.	Le dome de Mansart rayonnant, sur la masse grise du monument, absorbait et renvoyait les ors du soleil couchant. ~~~ Dans l'ether lumineux il semblait le symbole visible de la gloire d'une race.	0.0895503
Archer knew that Madame Olenska lived in a square near one of the avenues radiating from the Invalides; and he had pictured the quarter as quiet and almost obscure, forgetting the central splendour that lit it up.	Archer savait que Mme Olenska demeurait pres d'une des avenues qui aboutissent aux Invalides : pourquoi s'etait-il figure un quartier paisible et modeste, oubliant la brillante coupole qui regne sur lui.	0.574353
Now, by some queer process of association, that golden light became for him the pervading illumination in which she lived.	Par un singulier enchainement d'idees, cette lumiere doree devint pour lui la lumiere meme ou Ellen vivait.	0.26087
For nearly thirty years, her life--of which he knew so strangely little--had been spent in this rich atmosphere that he already felt to be too dense and yet too stimulating for his lungs.	Pendant pres de trente ans, la vie de Mme Olenska, -- cette vie dont il etait si etrangement ignorant, -- s'etait deroulee dans cette riche atmosphere.	0.231496
He thought of the theatres she must have been to, the pictures she must have looked at, the sober and splendid old houses she must have frequented, the people she must have talked with, the incessant stir of ideas, curiosities, images and associations thrown out by an intensely social race in a setting of immemorial manners; and suddenly he remembered the young Frenchman who had once said to him: "Ah, good conversation--there is nothing like it, is there?"	Il pensa a tous les beaux spectacles auxquels elle avait du assister, aux tableaux qu'elle avait du regarder, aux sobres et magnifiques demeures ou elle avait du entrer. ~~~ Il pensa aux gens avec qui elle avait du causer, aux idees, aux curiosites, aux images et aux comparaisons que remue sans treve une race d'une intense sociabilite, dans le charme d'une politesse traditionnelle.	0.0228422
Archer had not seen M. Riviere, or heard of him, for nearly thirty years; and that fact gave the measure of his ignorance of Madame Olenska's existence.	Tout a coup, Archer se rappela le jeune Francais qui lui avait dit une fois : << Une conversation interessante, il n'y a rien de tel, n'est-ce pas ?	0.392267
More than half a lifetime divided them, and she had spent the long interval among people he did not know, in a society he but faintly guessed at, in conditions he would never wholly understand.	>> Il n'avait jamais revu M. Riviere, ni entendu parler de lui depuis trente ans. ~~~ Tout ce qui avait rapport a Mme Olenska etait pour lui si lointain ! ~~~ Il etait reste separe d'elle pendant la moitie de sa vie.	-0.128
During that time he had been living with his youthful memory of her; but she had doubtless had other and more tangible companionship.	Elle avait passe ce long intervalle de temps parmi des gens qu'il ne connaissait pas, entouree d'une societe dont il pouvait a peine se faire une idee.	0.2625
Perhaps she too had kept her memory of him as something apart; but if she had, it must have been like a relic in a small dim chapel, where there was not time to pray every day....	Lui, il avait vecu avec son souvenir ; mais autour d'elle il y avait eu toute une societe, toute une vie...	0.109091
They had crossed the Place des Invalides, and were walking down one of the thoroughfares flanking the building.	Ils traverserent la Place des Invalides et suivirent une des avenues qui longent le monument.	0.61875
It was a quiet quarter, after all, in spite of its splendour and its history; and the fact gave one an idea of the riches Paris had to draw on, since such scenes as this were left to the few and the indifferent.	Archer s'etonnait de ces grandes voies un peu desertes dans ce paysage de splendeur et d'histoire. ~~~ Paris, en verite, avait donc beaucoup de ces glorieux tresors, pour qu'autour de celui-ci il y eut le calme et le vide.	-0.0123529
The day was fading into a soft sun-shot haze, pricked here and there by a yellow electric light, and passers were rare in the little square into which they had turned.	Le jour s'evanouissait dans un leger brouillard, illumine par de rares rayons de soleil, et pique ca et la par les points jaunes des lampes electriques.	0.276562

It was a modern building, without distinctive character, but many-windowed, and pleasantly balconied up its wide cream-coloured front.	C'etait une construction moderne sans caractere, avec de nombreuses fenetres, et des balcons qui se detachaient avec elegance sur une haute facade blanche.	0.259322
On one of the upper balconies, which hung well above the rounded tops of the horse-chestnuts in the square, the awnings were still lowered, as though the sun had just left it.	Sur un des balcons superieurs, qui s'avancaient au-dessus des domes arrondis des marronniers, les stores etaient encore baisses ; le soleil venait de les quitter.	0.28705

He pictured Dallas entering that room with his quick assured step and his delightful smile, and wondered if the people were right who said that his boy "took after him."	Mais il ne voyait qu'une dame au pale visage, avec une masse de cheveux sombres, qui redresserait la tete vivement, se levant a demi pour tendre a Dallas sa longue main fine, ornee de trois bagues.	0.349966
Then he tried to see the persons already in the room--for probably at that sociable hour there would be more than one--and among them a dark lady, pale and dark, who would look up quickly, half rise, and hold out a long thin hand with three rings on it....	Archer imagina qu'elle serait assise sur un canape au coin du feu, et qu'il y aurait des azalees en fleurs derriere elle sur une table.	0.0401786

"It's more real to me here than if I went up," he suddenly heard himself say; and the fear lest that last shadow of reality should lose its edge kept him rooted to his seat as the minutes succeeded each other.	Et la crainte de sentir s'evanouir cette derniere illusion le tenait immobile sur le banc pendant que les minutes s'ecoulaient.	0.274967
